text.p: Boeing Commercial Airplane Group said Thursday it has speeded up plans to boost Boeing 737 production in response to increased demand for the jet.

The Boeing Co. unit said it will produce 17 of the twinjets per month by the third quarter of 1997, six months ahead of the schedule announced in June. The company now makes 8.5 of the planes per month.
Production will rise to 1O airplanes per month by January and 12 airplanes per month by the second quarter of 1997.
Boeing said it also is developing plans and working with suppliers to ensure that it can respond to even greater future demand for the 737.
